title: Instrument Sounds Quiz
description: Match musical instruments to their descriptions and families

questions.question: Which brass instrument has a slide mechanism instead of valves and is known for its rich, warm tone in jazz and orchestras?
Which woodwind instrument uses a single reed, has a distinctive warm tone, and is a staple of jazz music?
Which large stringed instrument is played upright, provides the bass foundation in an orchestra, and can be bowed or plucked?
Which percussion instrument consists of a set of tuned metal bars arranged like a piano keyboard and is struck with mallets?
Which instrument uses a double reed, has a nasal and penetrating tone, and often plays the tuning note 'A' for the orchestra?
Which keyboard instrument produces sound by plucking strings with quills rather than striking them with hammers?
Which instrument family does the saxophone belong to, despite being made of brass?
Which large brass instrument produces the lowest notes in the brass section and rests in the player's lap?
Which stringed instrument is slightly larger than a violin, has a deeper and warmer tone, and is held under the chin?
Which percussion instrument consists of two large copper bowls with drumheads that can be tuned to specific pitches?
Which instrument is sometimes called the 'king of instruments,' can fill a cathedral with sound, and is played using keyboards and pedals to control pipes?
Which woodwind instrument is the highest-pitched member of the standard orchestra and is played by blowing across an embouchure hole?
Which stringed instrument has 47 strings, a large triangular frame, and is played by plucking with the fingers?
Which brass instrument is coiled in a circular shape, has a wide bell, and produces a mellow, rounded tone often used in classical music?
Which instrument uses free metal reeds activated by air from a bellows squeezed by the player's arm?
